title: Peppermint Espresso Martini
directions: Prepare the rim: Lightly brush the rim of a coupe or martini glass with peppermint sauce or simple syrup, then dip the rim into crushed candy canes. Set glass in the freezer while you shake the drink.
In a cocktail shaker, combine vodka, cooled espresso, Kahlua, mint simple syrup, and white chocolate peppermint sauce.
Add a big handful of ice and shake hard for 15-20 seconds to build foam and chill properly.
Double strain into the chilled candy-cane-rimmed glass.
Float 3 coffee beans on top. Optionally drizzle a whisper of peppermint sauce inside the glass before pouring for a swirl effect.
notes: Mint syrup provides the freshness (0.5 oz is enough without taking over). White chocolate peppermint sauce adds body and a dessert factor without needing extra simple syrup. For a stronger mint hit, increase syrup to 0.75 oz. For sweeter and creamier, add another 0.25 oz of the sauce. For a stronger coffee punch, bump espresso to 1.25 oz and drop syrup slightly. Holiday variant: add 0.25 oz peppermint schnapps and reduce mint syrup to 0.25 oz so it doesn't go medicinal. Originally 1 oz espresso but user preferred 36g (~1.2 oz) which works well for more coffee depth.
